{"step_by_step_thinking": "When the interdental papilla protrudes from the rubber dam, it indicates that the rubber dam punch holes are not properly placed. The rubber dam punch holes should be placed between the teeth, and if they are placed too far, it can cause the interdental papilla to protrude. On the other hand, if the punch holes are placed too close, it can cause the rubber dam to tear and not cover the interdental papilla properly. Therefore, the most common cause of interdental papilla protruding from the rubber dam is that the punch holes are placed too far.", "answer_choice": "C"}
